u2ByU-rytgpeEGuorX-dgw.text: One of my absolute favorite stops in Singapore. Service is great, drinks are great, and the atmosphere is incredibly fun. Only downside would be price - be prepared to spend $20-25 a drink. Oh, and the few food offerings they have are pretty awesome too.

aqeUAac2QL03ZOKU8PN8jQ.text: Very cosy speakeasy that plays lovely prohibition era style music behind an unmarked door at a hotel lobby.Drinks are somewhat smallish but rather tasty. The complimentary slider (before 8:30pm) a welcome gift.Excellent service from staffs.

Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore

PEUWIxR_wKGxkxx8gKwtqA.text: This place is a hidden gem! Located behind a black door in the Marriott at Tang Plaza is this awesome little bar. The drinks were phenomenal! You are create with a coffee martini as a welcome drink. I had a raspberry sour type drink and then a delicious New York sour with smoke blown into it and a cute marshmallow garnish. I was hungry and got the sirloin as a snack. The entire staff was highly attentive as I also kept finishing my bowl of crackers and it was instantly refilled. I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore

X5Vyy8mUH3SqAx5oxDnn2g.text: The Other Room is a very cool newish bar in an unexpected place - off the lobby of a hotel and the Marriott Hotel at that.  But they are doing some amazing work here with both infused liquors as well as barrel aged Cocktails, so it's definitely worth seeking out.  Plus, if you ever needed a break from shopping on Orchard Road, this would be a great place although it is open only in the evenings.  Anyway, upon arrival, I received a welcome espresso martini which was served in an eye drop bottle!  Very cool although I opted not to use the tincture and went straight for the bottle .  I tried one of their bottle aged cocktails - Boulvardier - which was really good, as the barrel aging helps smooth out the Campari just a bit.  It was also served with a beer back, which made it doubly enjoyable.  I also tried one of my usual drinks - a Vieux Carre, which was also executed very well.  Overall, I loved the drinks, the concept and the excellent service here.  And it's also great to see a new cocktail bar that isn't on Hong Kong or Amoy Street.  There is a small food menu as well, which I didn't have a chance to try.  But there will be a next time, and definitely looking forward to it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore. Welcome drink - espresso martini
Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore. Barrel aged boulevardier with a beer back
Photo of The Other Room - Singapore, Singapore. The non descript entrance off the lobby

q-vBSLhBZnphw3kdHLxBXg.text: Stylish throwback. Great service, fun atmosphere. Even finding it and getting in are part of the experience ;)

CEvW046wJgH0lhfLaMIRag.text: Definitely my new favorite bar in the area. Ambiance is just perfect for a nightcap and pre or post dinner date. Order the reverse gin & tonic!

w7nRT_XZKZULGdVEc6RSeQ.text: Love this place! The cocktails are amazing! The staff are super passionate about the drinks and will tailor a cocktail to your taste. Thank you for a great night!
